segment.source: Troubleshooting iPhone error messages during enrollment
segment.target: Troubleshooting iPhone error messages during enrollment

segment.source: What is the company portal?
segment.target: What is the company portal?

segment.source: The company portal is your company’s interface that lets you manage your work computers and devices, or manage your personal computers or devices that you choose to use at work.
segment.target: The company portal is your company’s interface that lets you manage your work computers and devices, or manage your personal computers or devices that you choose to use at work.

segment.source: The company portal can be a website that you go to, or can be an app that you install to your device.
segment.target: The company portal can be a website that you go to, or can be an app that you install to your device.

segment.source: What can I do with the company portal?
segment.target: What can I do with the company portal?

segment.source: Once you add your computer or device to the company portal, you can browse for company apps to install, manage other devices that you have added, and find contact information for your IT administrator.
segment.target: Once you add your computer or device to the company portal, you can browse for company apps to install, manage other devices that you have added, and find contact information for your IT administrator.

segment.source: What happens when I add a computer or device to the company portal?
segment.target: What happens when I add a computer or device to the company portal?

segment.source: When you add a computer or device to the company portal, some software may be installed or an app may be downloaded (depending on the device).
segment.target: When you add a computer or device to the company portal, some software may be installed or an app may be downloaded (depending on the device).

segment.source: You are also giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.
segment.target: You are also giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.

segment.source: For more information, see What Happens if You Add a Device to the Company Portal.
segment.target: For more information, see What Happens if You Add a Device to the Company Portal.

segment.source: What kind of computers or devices can I add to the company portal?
segment.target: What kind of computers or devices can I add to the company portal?

segment.source: Windows 8.1 devices
segment.target: Windows 8.1 devices

segment.source: Windows RT devices
segment.target: Windows RT devices

segment.source: Windows Phone 8
segment.target: Windows Phone 8

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1

segment.source: iPhones and iPads
segment.target: iPhones and iPads

segment.source: Android devices
segment.target: Android devices

segment.source: Can I remove a computer or device from the company portal?
segment.target: Can I remove a computer or device from the company portal?

segment.source: Yes, you can either remove or reset a computer or device from the company portal.
segment.target: Yes, you can either remove or reset a computer or device from the company portal.

segment.source: There is a difference between remove and reset:
segment.target: There is a difference between remove and reset:

segment.source: When you remove a computer or device, you won’t be able to access the company portal from that device anymore, and some company data may be removed from your device.
segment.target: When you remove a computer or device, you won’t be able to access the company portal from that device anymore, and some company data may be removed from your device.

segment.source: When you reset a computer or device, the company portal attempts to reset your computer or device back the manufacturer’s default settings.
segment.target: When you reset a computer or device, the company portal attempts to reset your computer or device back the manufacturer’s default settings.

segment.source: This may result in all data, both company data and personal data, being removed.
segment.target: This may result in all data, both company data and personal data, being removed.

segment.source: For more information, see What Happens if You Remove or Reset a Device Using the Company Portal.
segment.target: For more information, see What Happens if You Remove or Reset a Device Using the Company Portal.

segment.source: Why don’t I see all of my devices in the company portal?
segment.target: Why don’t I see all of my devices in the company portal?

segment.source: In order to see a device, it must be added to the company portal.
segment.target: In order to see a device, it must be added to the company portal.

segment.source: Browse to the company portal as directed by your administrator and follow the steps for your device.
segment.target: Browse to the company portal as directed by your administrator and follow the steps for your device.

segment.source: You also won’t see devices that are owned and managed by your company.
segment.target: You also won’t see devices that are owned and managed by your company.

segment.source: I get a "Compliance State is Unknown" message
segment.target: I get a "Compliance State is Unknown" message

segment.source: Intune is trying to evaluate whether your device is in compliance with policies that your IT administrator has set.
segment.target: Intune is trying to evaluate whether your device is in compliance with policies that your IT administrator has set.

segment.source: If this takes more than a few minutes, try tapping Check Compliance.
segment.target: If this takes more than a few minutes, try tapping Check Compliance.

segment.source: If that doesn't work after a few more minutes, contact your IT administrator for help.
segment.target: If that doesn't work after a few more minutes, contact your IT administrator for help.

segment.source: I need to install a new version of the company portal
segment.target: I need to install a new version of the company portal

segment.source: If your version of the company portal is no longer supported, or there is a newer version of the company portal available, use the following procedures to update your device.
segment.target: If your version of the company portal is no longer supported, or there is a newer version of the company portal available, use the following procedures to update your device.

segment.source: To update your Windows device
segment.target: To update your Windows device

segment.source: Navigate to the Windows Store and search for company portal.
segment.target: Navigate to the Windows Store and search for company portal.

segment.source: Follow the installation directions.
segment.target: Follow the installation directions.

segment.source: If you are unable to access the Windows Store, contact your administrator.
segment.target: If you are unable to access the Windows Store, contact your administrator.

segment.source: To update your iOS device
segment.target: To update your iOS device

segment.source: The Apple AppStore will alert you when a new version of the company portal is available.
segment.target: The Apple AppStore will alert you when a new version of the company portal is available.

segment.source: Follow the directions in the alert to update your device.
segment.target: Follow the directions in the alert to update your device.

segment.source: I receive an error that my computer is already enrolled
segment.target: I receive an error that my computer is already enrolled

segment.source: This means that your computer is already added to the company portal, but is not linked to your user account yet.
segment.target: This means that your computer is already added to the company portal, but is not linked to your user account yet.

segment.source: Follow this procedure to link your computer to your user account and complete the process.
segment.target: Follow this procedure to link your computer to your user account and complete the process.

segment.source: To link your computer
segment.target: To link your computer

segment.source: On the computer that you wish to link to your account, click Start then click Microsoft Intune Center.
segment.target: On the computer that you wish to link to your account, click Start then click Microsoft Intune Center.

segment.source: Open the company portal.
segment.target: Open the company portal.

segment.source: Follow the prompts to link the computer to your user account.
segment.target: Follow the prompts to link the computer to your user account.

segment.source: Troubleshooting iPhone error messages during enrollment
segment.target: Troubleshooting iPhone error messages during enrollment

segment.source: If you encounter errors while enrolling your iPhone, follow the instructions below.
segment.target: If you encounter errors while enrolling your iPhone, follow the instructions below.

segment.source: DeviceCapReached
segment.target: DeviceCapReached

segment.source: Issue: This message indicates that you have too many mobile devices enrolled already.
segment.target: Issue: This message indicates that you have too many mobile devices enrolled already.

segment.source: Workaround: Before you enroll another mobile device, you must remove one of your currently enrolled mobile devices from the company portal.
segment.target: Workaround: Before you enroll another mobile device, you must remove one of your currently enrolled mobile devices from the company portal.

segment.source: APNSCertificateNotValid
segment.target: APNSCertificateNotValid

segment.source: Issue: This message indicates that there is a problem with the certificate that allows your mobile device to communicate with your company’s network.
segment.target: Issue: This message indicates that there is a problem with the certificate that allows your mobile device to communicate with your company’s network.

segment.source: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message APNSCertificateNotValid while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message APNSCertificateNotValid while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: AccountNotOnboarded
segment.target: AccountNotOnboarded

segment.source: Issue: This message indicates that there is a problem with the certificate that allows your mobile device to communicate with your company’s network.
segment.target: Issue: This message indicates that there is a problem with the certificate that allows your mobile device to communicate with your company’s network.

segment.source: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message AccountNotOnboarded while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message AccountNotOnboarded while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: DeviceTypeNotSupported
segment.target: DeviceTypeNotSupported

segment.source: Issue: This message indicates that the mobile device type that you are trying to enroll is not supported.
segment.target: Issue: This message indicates that the mobile device type that you are trying to enroll is not supported.

segment.source: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message DeviceTypeNotSupported while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message DeviceTypeNotSupported while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: UserLicenseTypeInvalid
segment.target: UserLicenseTypeInvalid

segment.source: Issue: This message indicates that you cannot enroll your mobile device because your user account is not yet a member of a required user group.
segment.target: Issue: This message indicates that you cannot enroll your mobile device because your user account is not yet a member of a required user group.

segment.source: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message UserLicenseTypeInvalid while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message UserLicenseTypeInvalid while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: MdmAuthorityNotDefined
segment.target: MdmAuthorityNotDefined

segment.source: Issue: This message indicates that your IT administrator needs to configure the way the mobile devices in your company are managed.
segment.target: Issue: This message indicates that your IT administrator needs to configure the way the mobile devices in your company are managed.

segment.source: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message MdmAuthorityNotDefined while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Workaround: Contact your IT administrator and tell them that you received the message MdmAuthorityNotDefined while trying to enroll your mobile device, and to see the solution at Troubleshooting iOS Enrollment Errors with Microsoft Intune or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
